docs.snippet: HAVANA, Feb. 28 -- Clair Wilcox, acting chairman of the United States delegation to the United Nations conference on trade and employment, tonight withdrew the United States compromise proposal on new preferential tariff systems in a protest against...
docs.lead_paragraph: HAVANA, Feb. 28 -- Clair Wilcox, acting chairman of the United States delegation to the United Nations conference on trade and employment, tonight withdrew the United States compromise proposal on new preferential tariff systems in a protest against the "extreme" views incorporated in amendments filed by Walter Muller of Chile.
docs.abstract: Wilcox withdraws preference compromise in protest against amendments filed by Chile for Latin-Amer bloc; coordinating com approves US quantitative restrictions plan; Australia to resubmit compromise; com rejects Colombian plan

headline.main: COMPROMISE IN ITO WITHDRAWN BY U.S.; 'Extreme' Views in Amendment by Chile Block Accord on Restrictions Issue

docs.snippet: Foreign exchanges displayed a greater degree of stability last week. Business was of fair proportions in which offerings were no greater than buyers could absorb as of the moment. Contributing to the steadiness were operations for the month-end, and...
docs.lead_paragraph: Foreign exchanges displayed a greater degree of stability last week. Business was of fair proportions in which offerings were no greater than buyers could absorb as of the moment. Contributing to the steadiness were operations for the month-end, and some covering by earlier sellers. As a result "positions" were generally in order at the close.

headline.main: PERON RECUPERATING; Condition Called Satisfactory -Uruguayan President Phones

docs.snippet: The major incident of the week in the foreign exchange market was the strength of sterling "forwards." At Friday's close, ninety-day contracts were quoted at $3.96 1/2, or 6 3/4 cents under spot, compared with 10 cents in the preceding week, and 12...
docs.lead_paragraph: The major incident of the week in the foreign exchange market was the strength of sterling "forwards." At Friday's close, ninety-day contracts were quoted at $3.96 1/2, or 6 3/4 cents under spot, compared with 10 cents in the preceding week, and 12 and 14 cents, in the prior week. Contracts of nearer maturities revealed comparable strength.
